result.execSummary:
The defendant Jerauld Romell Sims was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Jerauld Romell Sims is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Jerauld Romell Sims was found guilty of Felon Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court ordered costs and surcharges WAIVED as defendant has other financial obligations regarding case 15TR3705 and this will cause a significant financial burden on the defendant. Provide a DNA sample;pay related surcharge by paying $100.00 per month starting 07-01-16; non-payment penalty shall result in a civil judgment.
Work release privileges. Defendant to report to the HOC on 02-16-16 before 5pm
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jerauld Romell Sims

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Order for Cancellation of Huber/Work Release/Electronic Survillance signed and filed.  Copy sent to State and HOC.

Huber/Work Release Modification Request:
Cancellation of Huber / Work Release / Electronic Surveillance Privileges Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes Section 303.08(2), 973.09(4), 973.03(4).
Request for Huber / Work Release Modification received from HOC and filed this date.  This case is assigned and forwarded to Judge Cimpl, Br 19, for review.  jm
See CCAP financial payment plan application for specific monthly due dates for this UTPPP.

Defendant Jerauld Romell Sims in court with attorney Michael Hart.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing hearing proceeded.  Statements made by State, Defense and Defendant.  

Court sentenced defendant serve 9 MONTHS in the House of Corrections, with work release privileges, with credit for 5 days time served.  Defendant to report to the House of Correction on February 16, 2016 before 5:00 p.m. 

-Court ordered costs and surcharges WAIVED as defendant has other financial obligations regarding case 15TR3705 and this will cause a significant financial burden on the defendant.  
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge by paying $100.00 per month starting July 1, 2016; nonpayment penalty shall result in a civil judgment.

Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.

Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Filed, Sentencing Referral Form

Defendant Jerauld Romell Sims in court with attorney Geoffrey R Misfeldt for Attorney Michael Hart.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  As to Count 1:    Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, jury instructions and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.   As to Count 2:  Pursuant to negotiations and on motion of the State Court dismissed the count.  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored. Court orders defendant provide a DNA sample.
Case is adjourned for sentencing in Branch 19.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 14, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Case reassigned per Chief Judge Directive 15-19.

Defendant Jerauld Romell Sims in court with attorney Michael Hart.  Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court is in trial and unable to conduct plea and sentencing hearing today.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 3, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Michael Hart in court, defendant Jerauld Romell Sims not in court, in custody.  Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Parties are requesting adjourned plea and sentencing date for further negotiations.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.
7.28.15 court date is being adjourned to 8.13.15.

Defendant Jerauld Romell Sims in court with attorney Michael Hart.  Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 7.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 07-28-2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jerauld Romell Sims in court with attorney Michael Hart.  Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 7.  Status conference scheduled for 06-16-2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jerauld Romell Sims in court with attorney Geoffrey Misfeldt for Michael Hart.  Nathaniel Adamson for Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Thomas McAdams, Branch 07.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 07.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 18, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Jerauld Romell Sims in court with attorney Geoffrey Misfeldt for attorney Michael Hart.  Christopher J. Ladwig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court ordered Absolute Sobriety.
Court ordered no possession or use of any dangerous weapons or firearms.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 13, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Court ordered arrest warrant withdrawn.  Recall issued.

Defendant Jerauld Romell Sims in court with attorney Geoffrey R. Misfeldt for attorney Michael Hart.  Christopher J. Ladwig appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Jerauld Romell Sims in court with attorney Michael Hart.  Christopher J. Ladwig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge McAdams, Branch 07.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.
